headline: What's driving the latest bout of AI deals? Analyst answers.
summary: Moor Insights & Strategy founder, CEO, and chief analyst Patrick Moorhead and Futurum CEO Daniel Newman discuss the AI milestones that could push Big Tech companies and hyperscalers even farther, including meeting compute capacity and demands, amid the latest round of artificial intelligence deals and partnerships. Also catch Daniel Newman and Patrick Moorhead weigh in on whether bubbles are forming in the AI trade. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: The AI Bubble Is Here. Why You Can Still Play the Stocks.
summary: Seaport Global analyst Jay  Goldberg is firmly in the bubble camp.  While chips are a critical part of the AI chain, he’s not sure that the business cycles are synced: “So saying that ASML,  Applied Materials Lam Research  and  KLA  are AI stories is a bit of stretch, but AI is definitely one of many important drivers of their business.”

headline: AI companies are looking 'sturdy' as 'little bubbles' form
summary: As major tech companies execute massive AI partnerships — namely Advanced Micro Devices' (AMD) deal with OpenAI (OPAI.PVT), and Nvidia's (NVDA) own business dealings with OpenAI, Intel (INTC), and Alibaba (BABA) — is Wall Street skeptical about a market bubble forming? Moor Insights & Strategy founder, CEO, and chief analyst Patrick Moorhead and Futurum CEO Daniel Newman chat with Josh Lipton about the "sturdiness" of Big Tech names than compared to the previous Dot-Com Bubble. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Buy the Surge in AMD Stock After Striking Partnership with OpenAI?
summary: Joining Broadcom and Nvidia, AMD is the latest major chip supplier to strike a multibillion-dollar deal with artificial intelligence pioneer OpenAI.

raw.headline: Buy the Surge in AMD Stock After Striking Partnership with OpenAI?

headline: OpenAI & other AI deals driven by 3 'performance improvements'
summary: OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) has signed a total of $1 trillion worth of deals this year. The world's most valuable private company is partnering with names like AMD (AMD), Nvidia (NVDA), Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Oracle (ORCL), CoreWeave (CRWV), Broadcom (AVGO), and Amazon (AMZN). Spear Invest founder and chief investment officer, Ivana Delevska, joins Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss the sustainability of the artificial intelligence (AI) trade's momentum and what OpenAI and other AI companies will be looking for in future partnerships. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Chip stocks react to Oracle, Trilogy Metals surges on US investment
summary: Yahoo Finance host Julie Hyman tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including chip stock reactions to The Information's reporting that Oracle (ORCL) lost nearly $100 million in Nvidia (NVDA) Blackwell chip rentals, PayPal (PYPL) launching its new advertising manager platform, and Trilogy Metals (TMQ) surging by over 200% after the Trump administration announced a 10% stake in the mineral company. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Is Broadcom’s Valuation Justified After OpenAI AI Chip Partnership Announcement?
summary: Let’s be honest, if you’re debating your next move with Broadcom stock, you’re not alone. With shares jumping an impressive 93.5% over the past year and a staggering 881.6% over the last five, plenty of investors are asking if the best gains are already behind us or if there’s more in store. In just the past week alone, Broadcom climbed 2.3%, shrugging off minor volatility and reminding us it is still a force to be reckoned with in the tech sector. But what’s really driving these moves? headline: Chip rally lifts markets, but Citi warns of profit-taking risk
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) inched higher ahead of Tuesday's opening bell, led by chipmaker stocks. In particular, AMD (AMD) stock is extending gains while Nvidia (NVDA) and Broadcom (AVGO) stocks also rise. Citi analysts warn that the tech-driven rally may pull back, saying "profit-taking risks have rapidly risen." Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Allie Canal examines the latest market moves. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Broadcom's Big AI Move In Japan Could Slash Data Center Power Use By Half
summary: Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) is expanding its footprint in Japan's artificial intelligence chip ecosystem through a new partnership with NTT to develop optical semiconductor devices designed to cut data center power use by up to 50%. Broadcom is strengthening its global AI leadership as it teams with Japan's NTT to produce advanced optical chips by 2026, aiming to tackle the soaring energy demands of AI data centers while boosting processing speed and efficiency.
